pageContext.claim: “We have thousands of judges and they need thousands of more judges. The whole system is corrupt.”
pageContext.analysis: First of all, there are only 334 judges who hear immigration cases. In theory, the Trump administration's addition of judges might push that number to 430 or so, but judges are also retiring at an unprecedented rate. The president has become fond of saying that no other country works this way, but in fact, most countries ultimately resolve immigration disputes in front of some independent arbiter.
